intro: Plagiobothrys linifolius, commonly known as the slenderleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Plagiobothrys linifolius is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub or chaparral habitats.
